question: It is true that biodiversity refers to the variety of life on Earth, including plants, animals, fungi, and microorganisms.
It is false that biodiversity includes only animals and plants, excluding microorganisms.
It is true that genetic biodiversity refers to differences in genes within the same species.
It is false that species biodiversity refers to the genetic variations within a single species.
It is true that ecosystem biodiversity refers to the variety of different ecosystems found on Earth.
It is false that biodiversity only exists at one level, which is genetic diversity.
It is true that the Amazon rainforest has high biodiversity due to the large number of species it supports.
It is false that deserts have higher biodiversity than rainforests.
It is true that bees play an important role in biodiversity by helping in pollination.
It is false that biodiversity has no economic value.
It is true that biodiversity loss is mainly caused by habitat destruction, pollution, climate change, overexploitation, and invasive species.
It is false that climate change has no impact on biodiversity.
It is true that overfishing has caused the decline of species like tuna and cod.
It is false that the introduction of invasive species does not affect native species in an ecosystem.
It is true that ecosystem biodiversity includes various habitats such as rainforests, deserts, and oceans.
It is false that genetic biodiversity only applies to plants and not animals.
It is true that forests play a major role in absorbing carbon dioxide and producing oxygen.
It is false that humans do not benefit from biodiversity in any way.
It is true that national parks and wildlife sanctuaries help in conserving biodiversity.
It is false that biodiversity is only important for scientific research and has no impact on human life.
It is true that habitat destruction leads to the loss of biodiversity.
It is false that pollution does not harm biodiversity.
It is true that sustainable farming and fishing can help protect biodiversity.
It is false that biodiversity is decreasing at a slow rate due to human activities.
It is true that ethical and cultural values influence biodiversity conservation efforts.
It is false that biodiversity loss has no effect on the ecosystemâ€™s balance.
It is true that forests act as the lungs of the Earth by producing oxygen.
It is false that poaching and hunting do not affect biodiversity.
It is true that ecotourism promotes the conservation of biodiversity.
It is false that planting trees does not contribute to biodiversity protection.
It is true that certain plants and animals are considered sacred in different cultures.
It is false that all species in an ecosystem are independent of each other.
It is true that biodiversity ensures food security by providing diverse crops and livestock.
It is false that invasive species always benefit the ecosystem.
It is true that coral reefs are highly biodiverse marine ecosystems.
It is false that all species contribute equally to ecosystem stability.
It is true that conservation programs like wildlife reserves help in protecting endangered species.
It is false that biodiversity loss does not affect climate regulation.
It is true that biodiversity loss can lead to food shortages and economic instability.
It is false that biodiversity has no impact on medicine and healthcare.
It is true that protecting biodiversity helps maintain healthy ecosystems.
It is false that economic activities like deforestation do not contribute to biodiversity loss.
It is true that governments and organizations play a key role in biodiversity conservation.
It is false that biodiversity loss has no impact on human well-being.
It is true that humans rely on biodiversity for food, water, and medicine.
